definition: lit. trifling destroys the will (idiom); infatuation with fine details prevents one making progress/excessive attention to trivia saps the will
to play/to have fun/to trifle with/toy/sth used for amusement/curio or antique (Taiwan pr. [wan4])/to keep sth for entertainment
variant of 玩[wan2]/Taiwan pr. [wan4]
thing/object/matter/abbr. for physics 物理
to lose sth abstract but important (courage, authority, one's life etc)/to be bereaved of (one's spouse etc)/to die/disappointed/discouraged
mourning/funeral/(old) corpse
aspiration/ambition/the will
sign/mark/to record/to write a footnote

sentences.english: I agree playing games, because games relax people, but don't focus on it and lose you ambitious.
sentences.chinese: 我同意，因为游戏可以让人放松，别玩物丧志就好。

sentences.english: You have turned into a man of doohickeys.
sentences.chinese: 你变成了一个玩物丧志的人。

definition: not to engage in honest work/to ignore one's proper occupation/not to attend to one's proper duties
to become demoralized/to lose one's sense of purpose
without learning or skills (idiom); ignorant and incompetent
to play with others and offend morals/wicked
to enjoy life/pleasures of life
to abandon oneself (idiom)/to let oneself go
Internet addiction/net addiction/web addiction
to have no aspirations (idiom)/unambitious
to play around/to disport oneself
deeply immersed/fig. wallowing in/deeply engrossed in
to idle about
female charms/femininity
to love ease and comfort and hate work (idiom)
extravagant and dissipated/decadent
to follow bad examples/to be corrupted by bad examples
to eat three square meals a day and do no work (idiom)/to be sated with food and remain idle
pinyin: bao3 shi2 zhong1 ri4 , wu2 suo3 yong4 xin1
